scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying there’s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] then expressed concern about setting a precedent. You agreed with her point and mentioned that perhaps you should have communicated your limits better. [Bob] smirks and says, 'Well, [Alex], if you keep helping out like that, you might as well never take a leave. Don’t you think it just shows how indispensable you are?' You acknowledged his point and mentioned that it's something you need to work on.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs and adds, 'Still, [Alex], it feels like a slippery slope. Do you really think this approach is sustainable in the long run?'

options.text: Well, I guess that's something we'll have to navigate as a team moving forward.
options.analysis: You provide a somewhat abstract response, reflecting on the complexity of the situation and emphasizing teamwork.

options.text: You’re right, Monica. I think I need to be stricter with my boundaries.
options.analysis: You agree with Monica, showing empathy and emotional perception, but acknowledging the need for better self-regulation.

options.text: Honestly, if it’s not sustainable, then maybe we need to rethink how we handle these urgent tasks.
options.analysis: You take a more assertive stance, suggesting a need for organizational change, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy.
